snippet: Anthony W. Batts was fired hours after the police union accused him of taking a passive approach during the riots that followed Freddie Gray’s death.
abstract: Baltimore Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake fires Police Commissioner Anthony W Batts hours after police union issues report that criticized police department's response to riots sparked by death of Freddie Gray while in police custody; Rawlings-Blake says Batts's ouster had nothing to do with report but with fact that Batts had been hindering efforts to address surge in violent crime in the city.

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr
byline.contributor: Sheryl Gay Stolberg reported from Washington, and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from New York. Richard Pérez-Peña contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Anthony W. Batts was fired hours after the police union accused him of taking a passive approach during the riots that followed Freddie Gray’s death.

headline.main: Baltimore Fires Police Chief in Wake of Unrest and Crime Surge
headline.print_headline: Baltimore Fires Police Chief Buffeted on All Sides
